page.title: 03CLUB-BARNS FOLD FISHING CLUB
page.content: A private fishing club based on two former reservoirs (Beacon 10.7 acres,Barns 10.8 acres), Barns Fold has 50 members from the Fylde,East Lancashire,Bury and Cheshire.For an annual premium, members may fish for rainbow and brown trout, some of which are reared in cages in the reservoirs.There is a clubhouse,a store shed and a large caravan where members may stay overnight. There is a great deal of wildlife to be found in the surrpunding area.Mammals include rabbits, hares, foxes, stoats, weasels, hedgehogs, grey squirrels, roe deer. Birds regularly seen here are coots, pochard and mallard ducks, herons, Canada geese, sandpipers, curlews, wood pigeons, woodcocks, pheasants, and, rarely, the grasshopper warbler.
